page.title: 08Interview with Mr.Farmer 2
page.content: The blacksmith shop declined because the tractor took the place of the horse.Although finding new work such as making ornate gates and even a ships boiler, the shop closed when Mr Farmer retired. The village as a place to grow up in was very different to today.Houses were made of stone.The walls were 1.5 m thick and parafin oil lamps gave out light.Wood or coal gave out heat and the cooking was done on a range.The church was very important.All children went to sunday school.Parents often went to the vicar for advice on important letters and matters.In the village there was one shop,a general store selling suits to provisions. Families made their own entertainment ,finding an instrument or making up dances.Everyone went to bed early and awoke early for another tiring day.
